private_information: Single shared power feed for all instruments on this satellite
Cannot point at two directions at once; turning causes a period with no pointing
Switch-on duration for an instrument is 2 time units; switch-off duration is 1 time unit
satellite0.goal: Assist in achieving the observation goals (have required images) and end with pointing(satellite0, Phenomenon5)

private_information: Single shared power feed for all instruments on this satellite
Cannot point at two directions at once; turning causes a period with no pointing
Switch-on duration for an instrument is 2 time units; switch-off duration is 1 time unit
satellite1.goal: Assist in achieving the observation goals (have required images) and allow final pointing constraint for satellite0 to be satisfied

orchestrator.goal: Generate a PDDL domain and problem that models the multi-satellite observation scheduling problem and respects all constraints (durative actions, power feed exclusivity, calibration, pointing, slew and calibration durations), minimizing total-time

public_information: Each instrument has a fixed calibration target direction
Slew times are symmetric and specified in slew_time table
Calibration times specified in calibration_time table
Take_image action duration is 7 time units and yields have_image(direction, mode) at end
Switch-on duration is 2 time units (instrument becomes powered at end) and clears calibration at start
Switch-off duration is 1 time unit (instrument is switched off immediately at start and power becomes available at end)
During slewing the satellite points to no direction until the end of the slew
Power feed per satellite is unique: only one instrument can occupy it at a time

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent temporal PDDL problems. You will be provided environment details and agent constraints. Produce a PDDL domain and problem that capture durative actions (slew, switch_on, switch_off, calibrate, take_image), numeric durations from given tables, power exclusivity per satellite, per-instrument calibration and mode support, pointing constraints, and the objective to minimize total-time. Keep actions clearly associated with agents where applicable.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
The satellite0's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->satellite0->private_information}.
The satellite1's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->satellite1->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated temporal model, respecting the constraints of each agent and the numeric duration tables. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. Provide only the PDDL domain and problem files enclosed between <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags respectively.
